intro: Ophiorrhiza baishaiensis, commonly known as the Baishai hibiscus, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in China, India, and parts of the Indochinese peninsula. This shrub typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth and mountainous areas. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
